channel.title: My First Custom Sword & Shield
channel.description:
Hope You Like It! This is my first graphic so please don't hate.
[img]http://i1093.photobucket.com/albums/i430/clawzownu/sword1front.jpg[/img] [img]http://i1093.photobucket.com/albums/i430/clawzownu/sword1side.jpg[/img]
Shield
[img]http://i1093.photobucket.com/albums/i430/clawzownu/shield1front.jpg[/img] [img]http://i1093.photobucket.com/albums/i430/clawzownu/shield1side.jpg[/img]
Hope you like and I hope to do better models in the future.

item.title: My First Custom Sword & Shield
item.dc:creator: @DessertSun DessertSun
item.description:
@DessertSun wrote:

Hmmmmmmmm…
I dont like the sword, but the shield looks good for me.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Custom Sword & Shield
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

These would be good for a cardboard cut out fight, but not for games.

Try selecting your object and scaling it so that it is thicker, from there work on the edges of your models. I tend to join the side faces of my shield (ctrl + j), i think it looks better like that (not always, but for shield like yours it does). Try doing that with the edges of your blade as well, swords generally have sharp sides.

Read full topic

item.title: My First Custom Sword & Shield
item.dc:creator: @poopler40 poopler40
item.description:
@poopler40 wrote:

these seem good for your first models, but you should show a wire frame. Your sword is flat and the edges are dull, you really would not be able to cut any thing.

Read full topic
